parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I reprove, rebuke, discipline, (b) I expose, show to be guilty. Of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Instruction, command, order, authority. From epitasso; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look down upon, despise. From peri and phroneo; to think beyond, i.e. Depreciate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
